title: Profile and preferences
content:
The profile and preferences part of the user interface includes information about user profile, preferences, contact details, and other user settings. Click your user name in the upper right corner and select User profile to open the Profile & Preferences page.

Profile

Click your user name in the upper right corner to open the Profile & Preferences page. The following are available there:

<Image>

Click Change image to select an image to upload, or to change the existing image. The User profile is displayed with the current image. You may drag and drop an image into the User profile.

View calendar

Click the link to display your on-call shifts.

This link only displays if On-Call Schedule management is enabled. For more information, see On-Call Schedule Management.

Preferences

Property Description
Choose language

Select the user interface language from the drop-down list. The selected language determines the locale, time display format (12-hour or 24-hour), and number formatting for INTEGER and DOUBLE data types.

Because of a known issue, your change to the language setting is temporary and your language setting will be automatically changed to empty or English later. If you want to change the language setting permanently, contact your administrator to prevent it from being overwritten again through editing the People UI.
Use high contrast mode

Displays the screen in high contrast mode.

By default, the screen isn't displayed in high contrast mode.
Enable desktop notification

Enables desktop notification for new chat messages (if available). The following browsers support this feature:

  • Google Chrome
  • Mozilla Firefox
  • Apple Safari (OSX)

By default, desktop notification isn't enabled.
Approval delegation settings Click the link to go directly to the Approval delegation section of the Service Portal.
Security settings

Click Security settings to open the Security settings dialog box, where you can verify your passcode for all of your encryption domains and for strong identity validation.

Each encryption domain requires a separate verification code. Once your passcode is verified for any encryption domain, it's automatically verified for strong identity validation as well.

If you want to change your passcode, click the Change passcode link.
Manage passcode verifications

Click Manage passcode verifications to generate passcode verification codes for selected users for strong identity validation. For more information, see Assign verification codes.
This link is for verification codes for strong identity validation only. Verification codes for encryption domains are assigned from the Encryption domains page. For more information, see Encryption domains. The link appears only if Strong identity validation is enabled and you have permission to generate verification codes.
Notification settings Click Notification settings to go to the Notification settings page. For more information, see Notification settings.
Personal access tokens Click Personal access tokens to launch the Personal access tokens page in Service Portal. See Use OData for BI integration for details.
Data domains Displays the list of data domains assigned to you.

Page preferences

Property Description
Home page

The default home page is My dashboards > Dashboard. You can change the home page by selecting from the drop-down. You must refresh the page to make your selection effective.

For more information, see the Page tabs section.
Custom landing pages

Each module in the solution has its default landing page. For example, in Problem Management the default is the Problems page.

You can change the default landing page by clicking Add page and selecting from the drop-down. For example, you can change the Problem Management landing page to Hot Topic Analytics. You must refresh the page to make your selection effective. To remove a selection, click X and refresh the page.

For more information, see the Page tabs section.
Default dashboard Specify an initial dashboard that you see from My dashboards > Dashboard after login.

Page tabs

If you hover over a tab at the top of a page, an icon is displayed:

If the tab is the user customized landing page for the module, the icon is highlighted:

Click the icon to display the following menu:

If you are on the landing page for the module, the following menu displays:

If you are on the page chosen as the new home page, the following menu displays:

You can use the menu to select or deselect a landing page for a module, and to select a page as your home page, or revert to the default home page.

Click Manage pages to return to the Profile page.

Area of expertise

You can view and add your expertise skills in the Area of expertise field. When you view the request/incident details, the system will recommend relevant experts based on the expertise skills information.

See Expert recommendation for ticket handling settings.

Contact details

Displays your phone numbers and email address.

Your group memberships

Displays the groups of which you are a member.

Click View calendar next to a group to go to the group calendar in On-Call Schedule Management.

Your employees

Displays the employees who report to you. This section only appears if you are a manager.

  • Click View calendar next to an employee to go to the calendar for the selected employee.
  • Click Generate verification code next to an employee to assign a verification code to the selected employee.

Schedule

To open your schedule:

  1. Click your user name in the upper right corner to open the Profile & Preferences page.
  2. Click Schedule.

This page only displays if On-Call Schedule management is enabled. For more information, see On-Call Schedule Management.

Notification settings

Administrators can define which notifications are sent for specific events. Agents can then customize when they want to receive these notifications, by specifying work status and/or ticket priority. The list of events can be customized in the Lists module. For more information, see Edit a list.

  • Use of a public distribution list for a group notification overrides notification preferences.
  • To enable this functionality, make sure the Enable user notification preferences setting is set to On in the Application settings page. For details, see Application settings.
  • If you have customized the SAWPriority list, users that have changed their notification preferences may not receive email notifications. To fix this, users should go to Profile & Preferences > Notification Settings and set their preferences again as desired.

To specify notification settings:

  1. From the Main menu:

    1. Click your user name in the upper right corner of the screen.

    2. Click Notification Settings.

    You can specify the following:


     

    Notify me during

    Default values are:

    • Working hours
    • On call
    • Off work
    • Vacations
      To view the default work status values, you must enable the On-Call Schedule feature. For more information, see On-Call Schedule Management.
    Notify me about

    Any of the defined list of events. You are only able to view events for records for which you have View permission.

    Request

    • SLA threshold reached
    • Assigned to group
    • SLA is breached
    • Assigned to me

    Incident

    • SLA threshold reached
    • SLA is breached
    • Assigned to me
    • Assigned to group

    Change

    • Change deployment denied
    • Change plan denied
    • Change ECAB denied

    Task and Approval

    • Assigned to me
    • Pending approval
    • Assigned to group
    • Pending task
    • Approval reminder

    • When selected, notifications of any displayed priority are sent to a user for the specified event.

      To specify that notifications will be sent only for records of a certain priority, click Advanced and select each priority that you want to delete from the list. To add a deleted priority back to the list, click next to the existing items and select the new priority from the list.

    • When deselected, notifications specified in Enable agent notification preferences are never sent.
    • For each Assigned to group event, notifications sent to a group distribution list will override the setting in the user profile. For example, although a user doesn't select Assigned to group for Request in the user profile, the user may still receive notifications about requests assigned to a group that the user belongs to. This happens when a request notification template has the Use group email setting enabled. For more information, see Settings in a notification template.
  2. Click Save.
